notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat JBoss Fuse 6.3 and Red Hat JBoss A-MQ 6.3.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Fuse provides a small-footprint, flexible, open source enterprise service bus and integration platform. Red Hat A-MQ is a standards compliant messaging system that is tailored for use in mission critical applications.

This patch is an update to Red Hat Fuse 6.3 and Red Hat A-MQ 6.3. It includes bug fixes, which are documented in the patch notes accompanying the package on the download page. See the download link given in the references section below.

Security fix(es):

* infinispan: invokeAccessibly method from ReflectionUtil class allows to invoke private methods (CVE-2019-10174)

* js-jquery: Cross-site scripting via cross-domain ajax requests (CVE-2015-9251)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat JBoss Fuse/A-MQ 6.3 R15 security and bug fix update

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: jQuery before 3.0.0 is vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attacks when a cross-domain Ajax request is performed without the dataType option, causing text/javascript responses to be executed.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Cross-site scripting via cross-domain ajax requests
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

Installation instructions are located in the download section of the customer portal.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

vulnerabilities.title: jquery: Cross-site scripting via cross-domain ajax requests

cwe.name: Use of Externally-Controlled Input to Select Classes or Code ('Unsafe Reflection')

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in Infinispan such that the invokeAccessibly method from the public class ReflectionUtil allows any application class to invoke private methods in any class with Infinispan's privileges. The attacker can use reflection to introduce new, malicious behavior into the application.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: infinispan: invokeAccessibly method from ReflectionUtil class allows to invoke private methods
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat OpenStack Platform's OpenDaylight contains the vulnerable library. This library is a requirement of other dependencies (Karaf and Hibernate). Under supported deployments, the vulnerable functionality is not utilized. Based on this, no OpenDaylight versions will not be fixed.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

Installation instructions are located in the download section of the customer portal.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
There is no known mitigation for this issue.

vulnerabilities.title: infinispan: invokeAccessibly method from ReflectionUtil class allows to invoke private methods
